title: Herman Cain
deleted: After Cain's death, a [[Reddit]] subreddit called HermanCainAward was created. It allows users to submit examples of people that shared Cain's views on COVID-19 but later got sick with the disease.<ref>{{Cite web|title=r/HermanCainAward|url=https://www.reddit.com/r/HermanCainAward/|access-date=2021-09-21|website=reddit|language=en-US}}</ref>

title: Herman Cain
deleted: After Cain's death, a [[Reddit]] subreddit called [https://www.reddit.com/r/HermanCainAward/ /r/HermanCainAward] was created. It allows users to submit examples of people that shared Cain's views on COVID-19 but later got sick with the disease.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Loofbourow|first=Lili|date=2021-09-21|title=The Unbelievable Grimness of HermanCainAward, the Subreddit That Catalogs Anti-Vaxxer COVID Deaths|url=https://slate.com/technology/2021/09/hermancainaward-subreddit-antivaxxer-deaths-cataloged.html|access-date=2021-09-21|website=Slate Magazine|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|date=2021-09-02|title=What is Reddit's Herman Cain Freedom Award and who qualifies?|url=https://www.thefocus.news/culture/what-is-the-herman-cain-award/|access-date=2021-09-21|website=The Focus|language=en-GB}}</ref>

title: Herman Cain
deleted: Cain died from [[COVID-19]] on July 30, 2020, at the age of 74. Cain, a survivor of [[colon cancer]], downplayed the risk of Covid-19, refused to wear a mask or to take other precautions against the disease, and attended a large rally for [[Donald Trump]], held against the advice of public-health officials, shortly before becoming ill.<ref name="reuters-covid">{{cite news | publisher = Reuters | title = Herman Cain, ex-presidential candidate who refused to wear mask, dies after COVID-19 diagnosis | url = https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-usa-cain/herman-cain-ex-presidential-candidate-who-refused-to-wear-mask-dies-after-covid-19-diagnosis-idUSKCN24V2OD | date= July 30, 2020}}</ref><ref name="politico-covid">{{cite news | work = Politico | url = https://www.politico.com/news/2020/07/30/herman-cain-death-covid-388081 | title = Political activist Herman Cain dies after Covid-19 diagnosis | date = July 30, 2020 | first1 = Caitlyn | last1= Oprisko | first2=Louis | last2= Nelson}}</ref> Following Cain's death, his verified Twitter account continued to promote [[Covid-19 misinformation|misinformation about the pandemic]], posting a month after Cain's death from Covid-19: "It looks like the virus is not as deadly as the mainstream media first made it out to be."<ref name="wapo-twitter">{{cite news | work = Washington Post | title = The curious saga of the deceased Herman Cainâ€™s living Twitter account | url = https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2020/08/31/herman-cain-twitter-account/ | date = August 31, 2020 | first = Travis | last = Andrews}}</ref>
